noun.description: A speech; a sermon, especially a long or tedious one.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in Tim Bobbin (1708–1786), satirist and caricaturist (real name John Collier). Origin uncertain. Perhaps from post-classical Latin nomine (in the formula in nomine patris in the name of the Father, etc. (Vulgate)) from classical Latin nōminē, ablative of nōmen.
